FuncDef:
The mpls l2vpn hard-pipe command enables the hard pipe function for static PWs on an interface.
The undo mpls l2vpn hard-pipe command disables the hard pipe function of static PWs on an interface.
By default, the hard pipe function is not enabled for static PWs.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth expansion ratio for an AC interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 100. The default value is 10.
The value is an integer for CES services, it ranges from 0 to 10000; for other types of services, it is in the range of 0 to 100, in kbit/s. The default value is 10 kbit/s.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-GigabitEthernet1/0/0.1] mpls static-l2vc destination 1.1.1.1 1 transmit-vpn-label 100 receive-vpn-label 100 tunnel-policy policy1
[*HUAWEI-Serial1/0/0/1:0] mpls static-l2vc destination 2.2.2.2 2 transmit-vpn-label 16 receive-vpn-label 17 jitter-buffer 64 tdm-encapsulation 32 idle-code FF rtp-header
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
IP hard pipe is a pipe technology that establishes a static PW over a static bidirectional co-routed LSP to simulate an SDH leased line.
Prerequisites
A static PW has been created using the mpls static-l2vc command.
Configuration Impact
After the mpls l2vpn hard-pipe command is configured on an interface, all static PWs on the interface, including the primary, secondary, and bypass PWs, have the hard pipe capability.
Precautions
The mpls l2vpn hard-pipe command can be configured only on the AC interfaces for static PWs, including SS-PWs and MS-PWs.
On the same interface, the mpls l2vpn hard-pipe command is mutually exclusive with the following commands:
qos-profile (interface view)user-queue (interface view)
